title: Manchester City starlet Leroy Sane's goal against Monaco cost one unlucky punter over £28,000
text:

Manchester City's fifth goal in their enthralling 5-3 win over Monaco cost one unlucky punter more than £28,000. 
City came from behind twice against the Ligue 1 leaders to earn a first-leg win in the last 16 of the Champions League. 
However, while most revellers were basking in the drama of the eight-goal thriller, one football fan was left feeling decidedly more glum after the match. 
That's because they were due to scoop almost €34,200 (£28,900) after predicting City to win 4-3 and Atletico Madrid to win 4-2 away to Bayer Leverkusen. 
With 10 minutes to go of both matches the bet was firmly on, with City leading 4-3 and Atleti winning 3-2 in Leverkusen. A fan was one goal away from winning big with a Champions League double on Tuesday night (Photo: Getty) The punter correctly predicted Atletico Madrid's 4-2 win over Bayer Leverkusen (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
However, Sane's 82nd-minute strike ended any hopes of a massive windfall for the punter and, to add insult to injury, Fernando Torres scored in the 86th minute of the other game to make it 4-2 to Atleti and ensure the fan missed out on the big win by just one goal. 
Germany international Sane took to Twitter after being alerted to the bet. He wrote: "I read about it in the newspapers... sorry for that poor guy." 
He wasn't that sorry though, as he accompanied the tweet with a laughing emoji. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
